parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Config

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Extract number from config entry.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>'''getNumber''' config

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> config: [[Config]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_value = [[getNumber]] ([[configFile]] [[gtgt|>>]] "CfgVehicles" [[gtgt|>>]] "Thing" [[gtgt|>>]] "maxSpeed");</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[configFile]], [[config / name]], [[configName]], [[count]], [[getArray]], [[getText]], [[inheritsFrom]], [[isArray]], [[isClass]], [[isNumber]], [[isText]], [[select]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 04:45, 3 March 2007 (CET)</dd>
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Donnervogel|Donnervogel]]'''<dd class="note">
Use getNumber to get [[Boolean|boolean]] values from a config entry. 1 equals [[true]], 0 equals [[false]].
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 13 September 2011</dd>
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Loki|Loki]]'''<dd class="note">
With an not existing entry, [[getNumber]] returns 0.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on Mar 28, 2014 - 07:53</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
(<template><title>arma3</title></template> 1.14), It's recommended to use [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] or [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]] to get variable cfg data rather than conditioning via [[isNumber]], [[isText]], [[isArray]], [[getNumber]], [[getText]] and [[getArray]] combination. <br>
Traditional workaround:
<code>_cfg = [[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> _SomeAddonClassName >> "DestructionEffects" >> "Smoke1" >> "type"
[[switch]] ( [[true ]]) [[do]]
{
	[[case]] ([[isNumber]] _cfg): {[[getNumber]] _cfg};
	[[case]] ([[isText]] _cfg): {[[getText]] _cfg};
	[[case]] ([[isArray]] _cfg): {[[getArray]] _cfg;};
	[[default]] {nil};
};
</code>
'''Recommended workaround:'''
<code>([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> _SomeAddonClassName >> "DestructionEffects" >> "Smoke1" >> "type") [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]];
</code>
To return default value once entry was not found, we can use [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]] instead of [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]].
<code>[([[configFile]] >> "CannonFire" >> "LightExp"),"lifeTime",0] [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]];//0.5
</code>
To compose collected [[Number]] into [[Array]], use [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]] instead.
<code>([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> _SomeAddonClassName >> "DestructionEffects" >> "Smoke1" >> "type") [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]];
</code>
To retype collected [[Number]] into [[Boolean]], use [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]]. Anything bigger than 0 is true, otherwise false. 
<code>([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> _SomeAddonClassName >> "DestructionEffects" >> "Smoke1" >> "type") [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]];
</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma1</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template></root>
